sentence.Network_en: Naivety bordering on obtuseness helped sustain his faith.

sentence.Network_en: Much of the contentment of that time was based on moral obtuseness.
sentence.Network_cn: 对那个年代的满意是基于道德上的一种惰性.

entry.def: Someone who is obtuse has difficulty understanding things, or makes no effort to understand them.

example.ex: I've really been very obtuse and stupid...
I'm a limited and obtuse clergyman while you're the expert.
example.tran: 你是专家，而我是个能力有限的愚笨牧师。

entry.def: An obtuse angle is between 90˚ and 180˚.

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being slow to understand
2. the quality of lacking a sharp edge or point

auth_sentence.content: Matched with more conventional pop their obtuseness can tend to give you a headache.
